schema.name: Healthyfied Tuna In Citrus Soy Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the white onion and set aside.
Thoroughly rinse the frozen tuna cubes under cold water.
In a mixing bowl, coat the thawed tuna cubes evenly with cornstarch.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add tuna cubes and sear until golden brown on all sides, approximately 3-4 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the sliced onion and sauté until transparent and soft, about 2 minutes.
Mix water, low sodium soy sauce, ground black pepper, and salt in a bowl.
Pour the soy sauce mixture into the skillet with onions and bring to a simmer.
Return the seared tuna cubes to the skillet and cook in the citrus soy sauce until well-coated and heated through, about 3 minutes.
Squeeze calamansi juice over the tuna and stir to combine.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb meal with our Healthyfied Tuna in Citrus Soy Sauce. This recipe cleverly combines the flavorful essence of low sodium soy sauce and the zest of calamansi, providing a heart-healthy option without sacrificing taste. Perfect for those watching their sugar intake but craving the satisfaction of a fulfilling indulgence.
